The Courseware Accessibility Study

Distance Education Survey Results (numbers in [ ] are number of responses)

There was most agreement among the participants on items 5 (I prefer to study alone) and on item 9 (When learning a new subject, I prefer to stay focused on that subject, learning as much as I can about it). The rating scales support the generalization that the participants were independent learners who prefer having others around to ask for help as required.

(CCE and EvNet)

[HOME] [Back to Appendix]

Part A: Learning Preferences 

For questions 1 through 10 please select the ONE of two choices in each question that best describes you personally. If both seem to apply to you, choose the one that applies more frequently. You are free to skip any question, though you are encouraged to complete them all.

Enter your Participant ID

1. I prefer to get new information in

Pictures, diagrams, graphs, or maps.
[6]

[3]

Jump in and contribute ideas.
[4] Sit back and listen
3. In a book with lots of pictures and charts, I am likely to

[4]

4. I remember best
[2]

[5]

5. I prefer to study
[0]

In a study group.
[7]

6. When I see a diagram or sketch in class, I am most likely to remember
[1]

The picture.
[6]

What the instructor said about it.
7. When someone is showing me data, I prefer
[2]

Charts or graphs.
[5]

Text summarizing the results.
8. When I have to work on a group project, I first want to
[5]

Have "group brainstorming" where everyone contributes ideas
[2]

Brainstorm individually and then come together as a group to compare ideas.
9. When I am learning a new subject, I prefer to
[7]

Stay focused on that subject, learning as much about it as I can.
[0]

Try to make connections between that subject and related subjects.
10. The idea of doing homework in groups, then assigning one grade for the entire group,
[1]

Appeals to me
[6]

Does not appeal to me.
